dqcnac.network_configuration.network_builder module

Simple network_configuration classes module.

dqcnac.network_configuration.network_builder.all_to_all(network: Network, nodes: Dict[str, Node], ebits: List[int], n_nodes: int)[source]

Create a network with an all to all topology.

Parameters:

  • network – the network

  • nodes – the nodes in the network

  • ebits – the ebits

  • n_nodes – the number of nodes in the network

dqcnac.network_configuration.network_builder.lnn(network: Network, nodes: Dict[str, Node], ebits: List[int], n_nodes: int)[source]

Create a network with a linear nearest neighbor.

Parameters:

  • network – the network

  • nodes – the nodes in the network

  • ebits – the ebits

  • n_nodes – the number of nodes in the network

dqcnac.network_configuration.network_builder.load_yaml(filename: str) → dict[source]

Load a yaml file and parser it into a dictionary

Parameters:

filename – the name of the file to parser

Returns:

a dictionary

dqcnac.network_configuration.network_builder.ring(network: Network, nodes: Dict[str, Node], ebits: List[int], n_nodes: int)[source]

Create a network with a ring topology.

Parameters:

  • network – the network

  • nodes – the nodes in the network

  • ebits – the ebits

  • n_nodes – the number of nodes in the network

dqcnac.network_configuration.network_builder.simple_network(n_nodes: int, device_type: str, network_topology: str = 'lnn') → Network[source]

Create a simple network.

Parameters:

  • n_nodes – number of nodes in the network

  • device – device type of devices in the network, either the name of one of the supported devices or a dictionary containing the device properties

  • network_topology – the topology of the network

Returns:

a network

dqcnac.network_configuration.network_builder.star(network: Network, nodes: Dict[str, Node], ebits: List[int], n_nodes: int)[source]

Create a network with a star topology.

Parameters:

  • network – the network

  • nodes – the nodes in the network

  • ebits – the ebits

  • n_nodes – the number of nodes in the network
